description: Freed Zaxara is a Sultai Midrange focused on the synergy of Zaxara, the Exemplary with Freed from the Real or Pemmin's Aura to generate infinite mana of any color. The same can be done using Bloom Tender or Arbor Elf + Land's Auras. From that point, any outlet can guarantee victory. As a consistent alternative plan, it has the package of Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation.
title: Freed Zaxara

description: Breya uses multiple infinite mana combos in order to infinitely cast her and use her ability to shoot down the entire table. We also use Demonic Consultation and Tainted Pact along with Jace and the new Thassa’s Oracle to get around Torpor Orb and Cursed Totem effects in order to win. Full suite of counters and tutors to make sure our assembled combos go through.
title: Breya Consultation

decklists.title: A Song of Turns and Dongers

description: A deck based around playing small creatures with evasion and chaining extra turns.
title: Edric Turns

description: A stax deck which ramps into Ruric Thar, then uses wipes and land destruction to win.
title: Thar Stax

description: A control deck which uses its commander to create a mana advantage over its opponents.
title: GAAIV Control

description: A fast deck which combos using Food Chain, with good matchups vs control/stax.
title: Food Chain Prossh

description: Enduring Renewal gravestorm which is built as an answer to creature-heavy metas.
title: Fruity Pebbles

description: Siona Druid is a deck that uses hermit druid as a one card win con as long as you have Siona on the battlefield. You do this by milling your deck with Hermit druid with Siona on the field, than you flashback Sevinne's reclamation targeting shielded by faith and concordant crossroads. This deck is definitely the best deck in the format and I have never lost with it and will never lose with it.
title: Siona Druid

description: Draw through your entire deck by turning your creatures into cantrips (Guardian Project, Beast Whisperer, etc) and rituals (Food Chain, Earthcraft, etc), as well as using large power based draw spells (Rishkar's Expertise, Greater Good, etc), then loop Oblivion Sower to mill out your opponents.
title: Goreclaw Stompy Storm

description: This deck seeks to consistently power out early wins by leveraging its commander Tymna, dorks and rituals to win with multiple one card win-conditions: Either cracking a Doomsday or Goblin Recruiter pile with her card draw or using her as Birthing Pod fodder to convert into a Kiki-Jiki and Felidar Guardian win. The deck plays best in creature-light metas where dorks can easily swing in to best utilize Tymna's card draw effect throughout the game to grind and threaten multiple wins.
title: Tymna Tana Snoop

decklists.title: You can't beat me! I'm full of tinier men!

description: 5 color Hulk decks tend to be aggressive, fast combo decks that often layer other win conditions on top of the Flash Hulk combo, including hermit druid, bomberman, scepter, and consult. The commander is often there to primarily serve as an outlet with several colors, though may provide layering such as with Najeela.
title: 5 Color Flash Hulk

description: Urza, Lord High Artificer leverages fast artifact mana and wincons such as Isochron Scepter + Dramatic Reversal, and Power Artifact + Grim Monolith. Additionally, Urza has the unique benefit of breaking parity with mana denial stax pieces such as Static Orb and Winter Orb. It also utilizes cards such as Trail of Evidence as powerful mana and card advantage engines. The Poly versions look to win with Polymorph / Proteus Staff getting Tidespout Tyrant to generate infinite mana.
title: Urza Powered Scepter

description: A sans-blue combo deck that features powerful graveyard reanimation targets, card advantage engines, and interaction. A proactive strategy with a light stax package, this deck aims to win through assembling the Squirrel Craft combo, and either swinging or using Goblin Bombardment.
title: Tymna Tana Reanimator

description: The basic strategy of the deck is to cast Lavinia and other stax effects onto the board early to slow down your opponents. This deck is very disruptive, and certainly struggles in very quick metas. Plays well against slower decks, Kats has a hard time against her. Best matchup for this deck by a mile is against storm, where Lavinia's restrictive text slows those decks down considerably. Key cards are Knowledge Pool, Omen Machine, Small Teferi Creature Teferi and Cursed Totem, just to name a few.
title: Lavinia Omen Pool

description: Pako and Haldan are a Partner pair that together create a huge amount of card advantage right out of the Command Zone. The deck's strategy is to go all in on casting and protecting Pako, then using Pako to grind out in the mid game, and then smother our opponents in value in the late game. Often, it wins by infinitely recurring extra turn spells.
title: Pako Midrange

description: A powerful and resilient combo deck aimed at maximizing deck speed, individual card strength, and value-scaling as the game progresses.
title: Thrasios Tymna Midrange

description: A combo deck that uses its commander in conjunction with other effects to assemble storm-like wins.
title: Zada Storm

description: A creature based stax deck that seeks to slow the game down and hate out its opponents. Eventually winning with a one card combo with the commander. The deck is very resilient to creature removal and packs a punch as you constantly threaten life totals with your slowly growing creatures.
title: Heliod Ballista

description: A control deck which uses the CST shell with a package of card advantage engines such as Compost and Runic Armasaur to trade speed for a better grind game. 4 Color Rashmi's name comes from the combination of a Curiosity effect and Vial Smasher, the Fierce, which create a pseudo-Rashmi, Eternities Crafter effect in a 4 color partner combination. This deck also includes an extensive mana dork hate package to keep both opposing mana production in check, as well as opposing commanders like Tymna and Najeela.
title: Curious Control

description: An efficient and stax-resistant Flash Hulk deck, which sacrifices playing white cards to utilize Sacred Guide with Laboratory Maniac to win the game at instant speed. Due to Laboratory Maniac's inherent synergy with forbidden tutors like Demonic Consultation or Tainted Pact, Sacred Hulk is a powerful, consistent, and efficient deck that attacks from multiple angles, and has no issue winning when Protean Hulk can't be used. Sacred Hulk is the best pick for slower, staxier metas out of the Thrasios/Tymna hulk decks.
title: Sacred Hulk

description: Kentucky Fried Kroxa is an adaptive, Parasitic combo deck, that focuses on hosing creature based strategies early and playing towards one of its combo finishes after interaction has been exhausted. Ideally, you are casting an early Praetors Grasp or Grinning Totem, yoinking a wincon, and holding it until your window opens. The deck will not race Sushi Hulk, but you can take early wins off of worldgorger dragon combos if the opportunity presents itself. FFO Xantcha, Anje, Foodchain Jeleva.
title: Kentucky Fried Kroxa

description: Tymna Kraum Breach focuses on quickly assembling wincons with one card enablers such as Ad Nauseam or Intuition. The deck puts a heavy emphasis on Ad Nauseam, Underworld Breach, and Dockside Extortionist flickers. Tymna Kraum Breach utilizes a lot of fast mana to power out either explosive wins or strong early card advantage engines such as Kraum or Rhystic Study. Tymna Kraum Breach usually seeks to be the fastest deck at the table, but it has the potential to grind when needed.
title: Tymna Kraum Breach

description: A stax deck which focuses on reanimating expensive and oppressive artifacts.
title: Daretti Stax

description: This is an adaptive combo-control list that aims to create a "100 card Doomsday pile" through activating Proteus Staff. The deck has a high density of interaction, and runs little to no dead cards. It plays well under stax conditions, and is able to shut down faster decks due to it's wide variety of efficient control options. With numerous flex spots, the deck can be easily customized for specific metagames.
title: Fblthp

description: A fast and consistent combo list which is highly interactive and difficult to shut down.
title: Food Chain Tazri

description: A fast reanimator deck which centers around Necrotic Ooze, Razaketh, and Jin-Gitaxias.
title: Nooze Reanimator

description: A sans-red version of midrange Ad-Naus, with asymmetrical hate pieces and more storm.
title: E-MAN

decklists.title: Is Brago really a CEDH general?

description: A stax list which uses repeatable draw effects and mana-blinking to break parity.
title: Brago Stax

description: This is an aggressive storm deck focused on Ad Nauseam and Underworld Breach. The extremely high density of nonland mana sources (specifically net positive ones) enable both explosive starts and very consistent main phase Ad Nauseams with little to none mana floating. Jeleva as a general provides a way to expend this surplus of mana the deck so easily generates, either when we keep hands with little action or when we get stopped and need to dig for “gas”.
title: Jeleva Storm

description: Sigil Hulk is a layered midrange-combo deck focused around Protean Hulk, Isochron Scepter, and Demonic Consultation. Thanks to the variety of effects and paths to victory, Sigil Hulk can be played in different metas against a variety of stax pieces. Often Sigil Hulk can grind out value better than anyone else at the table and play a win condition that avoids the stax pieces on the battlefield the most successfully.
title: Sigil Hulk

description: A sans-green version of midrange Ad-Naus, with asymmetrical hate pieces and stormy bits
title: Kraum MAN

description: Nin is an artifact combo list with a healthy dose of interaction and a little stax. Our gameplan is to generate infinite mana using one of our compact 2-card combos and find an outlet to kill the table (if Nin herself isn't available). While not as ubiquitous as 4-color Thrasios, Nin offeres a variety of helpful red stax pieces and interaction, enabling a deck style with all the payoff cards of a monoblue deck (High Tide, Vedalken Shackles) while still having a variety of powerful answers.
title: Nin Scepter

description: A deck that uses Muldrotha to recur hate or value pieces before its combo finish.
title: Muldrotha Midrange

description: An adaptive combo list focused on assembling a combo using Elsha and Sensei's Divining Top, as well as utilizing Underworld Breach lines. The deck utilizes the strong card advantage engine and flexibility in timing that Elsha's ability provides to progress its own gameplan while hindering others. The list boasts high card quality due to the winconless nature of its combos, allowing it to run a strong suite of interaction.
title: Elsha Top

description: Oracle Hulk is a Flash Hulk deck that combines the historic speed and efficiency of Flash as a win condition, with the card quality and resilience of Consultation to deadly effect. Oracle hulk is equally capable of keeping up with the fastest of the fast, as well as out-grinding the best of them. The deck is incredibly incredibly difficult to meaningfully disrupt, and will compete at the top level in all but the most hostile metas.
title: Oracle Hulk

description: An adaptive Abzan deck that aims to grind into the mid to late game through utilization of stax pieces, then pivots to game-ending combos.
title: Abzan Razaketh

description: *Meme* Squee is not for the faint of heart. He is not the most competitive commander but can be a ton of fun to pilot, and is valuable in being mostly unknown. The deck aims to assemble a combo that allows the looping of Squee from the graveyard with several redundant combo pieces and a fair share of stax effects. Customizable depending on meta, budget, or personal preference, the deck tends to goldfish, but can often short-cut loops. Use skullclamp and blood moon to win with a good ol' Squeeze!
title: The Immortal Nuisance

description: Kalamax offers a sizeable body that gladly attacks every turn putting pressure on various strategies. The value we can maintain off of regularly used instants is unparalleled. We are a pure control deck aiming to get to the mid to late game and grind our oppoents before going for a well backed combo finish. Many cards layer for infinte turns and really optimize the few tutors temur has to offer.
title: Kalamax Control Breach

description: This is a resilient yet fast combo deck built around many infinite mana combos that each can win the game on the spot if Selvala is in play. Using Selvala as a draw outlet, this deck produces large amounts of mana quickly from cards like Priest of Titania, then uses cards like Umbral Mantle, Staff of Domination, and Temur Sabertooth to reuse Selvala and win the game. This deck is capable of winning quickly, even through multiple pieces of interaction, but can still grind in the late game.
title: Selvala Twiddlestorm

description: Anje is a proactive deck that utilizes a high number of madness cards so that it can filter through its deck to assemble the WGD + Animate Dead combo and utilize Anje to draw its deck
title: Anje Madness

description: An aggressive Thrasios/Tymna list looking to leverage Hermit Druid and Cephalid Breakfast along with creature tutors to piece together quick wins while holding its own in later games with Oracle + Consult along with dual card advantage engines in the command zone
title: Thrasios Tymna Hermit Druid

description: A split reanimator/Doomsday list centered around Bomberman, WGD, and Doomsday.
title: Doomsday Breya

description: An all-in fast combo list which chains Arcum's ability using Paradox/Flute.
title: Paradox Arcum

description: Tatyova is a small card value engine with a high combo potential. You can win as early as turn 1 but more commonly on Turn 3 or 4 without any interruption.This deck is not scared to play the long game as you will out value your opponent in your card advantage as the games goes.
title: Tatyova Lands

description: A midrange combat-focus build with lots of interaction pieces.
title: Najeela Tempo

description: The primary win condition of the deck is Aetherflux Reservoir, found via Doomsday piles. Limited due to the nature of Mono-Black, K’rrik’s shortcomings are made up for by play as a predatory deck. Given that the deck aims to win between turns 3-5, we aren’t as “all-in” as other lists, despite having comparable speed. K'rrik's best matchups are playing into stax and in pods that lack countermagic and/or graveyard hate.
title: K'rrik Doomsday

description: Rakdos Worldgorger decks leverage Black's tutor suite and the availability of cheap outlet commanders to assemble the Worldgorger Dragon combo. Decks often feature anti-meta disruptive elements such as creature hate and hand hate.
title: Rakdos WGD

description: Kaalia decks can leverage Kaalia to drop in Razaketh for a powerful win condition or other splashy haymakers. Kaalia decks may leverage stax in order to slow down the board in order to assist in getting their commander online and supplementing the effects of the creatures that get cheated into play.
title: Kaalia Razaketh

description: A stax list which uses symmetrical discard effects and plays reanimator to break parity.
title: Neheb Handstax

description: 5c reanimator focusing on Worldgorger Dragon and Razaketh
title: Scion Reanimator

description: An Ad Nauseam focused combo list which leverages lifegain for better storm turns.
title: Mad Farm

description: A stax/hatebears deck which keeps hatebears alive using Alesha's reanimation.
title: Alesha Stax

description: A deck with a lot of tendies
title: Tendies Tribal

description: BUG Scepter storm decks tend to rely on the card quality of the BUG color combination to leverage the IsoRev combo, along with an infinite mana outlet in the command zone.
title: BUG Scepter

description: A sans-white version of the typically sans-red Oracle decks. Temur Sabertooth if dockside makes 5 plus mana that goes infinte draw your deck with Thrasios, Triton Hero. Spellseeker can get either Tainted Pact or Demonic Consultation or any relevant 2 cmc or less spell. We also play labman since we are on consult lines
title: Thrasios Vial Oracle

description: Adnaus/Earthcraft Ghave combo aims to slow the game down through cheap stax/hate pieces long enough to assemble an infinite combo with Ghave. Earthcraft, Ashnod's Altar and Phyrexian Altar are the key mana combo cards. Young Wolf and Strangleroot Geist are key counter cards. It's good against both grindy and aggro metas, as it can adapt to both. The rest of the deck is stax, midrange value and tutors.
title: Ghave Combo

description: A combo control deck which controls and stalls until a High Tide or Isorev combo win. Azami as a commander offers heavy card advantage at the cost of being expensive to cast and requiring wizards in play, as well as a combo outlet or engine with untaps.
title: Azami Scepter

description: A fast and graveyard-reliant combo deck which layers several win conditions together, often including Food Chain, Hulk, and sometimes Hermit Druid and Reanimator.
title: SBT Layered Combo

description: A Kiki-Jiki/Lab maniac reanimator list which uses Kess to flashback utility cards wincons
title: Grixis Twin

description: A control list which uses Taigam to get repeatable value, then generate infinite turns.
title: Taigam Turns

description: Rielle is a commander reliant deck that attempts to disrupt opponents tempo with moons and dork denial while using Rielle's ability to outdraw opponents and set up for late game wins by way of sheer card advantage. Most often the deck wins with Underworld Breach as an enabler to set up one of various combo options.
title: Rielle Breach

description: An anti-creature deck that hopes to control the board and make snakes. A reanimation package into Razaketh seeks to utilize the many bodies we can make to tutor up either Nest/Craft combo, or Blowfly Infestation to combo with Hapatra. Yawgmoth is a main combo engine as well. This deck thrives in metas with other staxy decks, as it can survive on low resources and whittle away those of other players.
title: Razaketh Hapatra

description: The main goal of the deck is to control the board long enough to deploy our commander with reasonable protection with plenty of interaction in the forms of counters. Once the board is under control, the ultimate goal is to take infinite turns
title: Kefnet Turns

description: Sygg Draw-Go is a deck that aims to control the table with counterspells while creating card advantage with its commander Sygg. The UB colors allow it to win with consultation combo. This deck relies on its opponnents taking damage with through combat and through their own cards, such as mana crypt. Otherwise, Sygg may fail to generate enough card draw to fuel the deck.
title: Sygg Draw-Go

description: A potent midrange deck which slows others down with stax while making big mana.
title: Chain Veil Teferi

description: A hatebears/stax deck with a reanimator subtheme which builds heavy into Tymna.
title: Blood Pod

description: A Zur storm deck leverages the ability for Zur to fetch Necropotence as well as threaten wins from hand with ad nauseam and consultation. Shimmer versions build to be able to win at instant speed with Shimmer Myr after paying a large amount of life to Necropotence
title: Zur Storm

description: A Control deck that seeks to control the game with early game card advantage and disruption until the late game, where it seeks to win when we can safely land a win condition. Tasigur is an important asset to the deck that can greatly help us in the late game by acting either as a political resource to recur disruption or as a source of card advantage.
title: Tasigur Control

description: A Flash Hulk combo deck layered with Hermit Druid, based around infinitely self-milling.
title: Breakfast Hulk

description: An adaptive list which is able to both combo early or grind out value in the lategame. It can threaten wins as early as turn 3, and can recover by grinding out value should that fail via Meren and other value engines. Its main win condition is a Protean Hulk pile, with a backup Earthcraft/Squirrel Nest win condition, and Razaketh lines that lead to both.
title: Meren Hulk

description: This build of Kykar is a fast combo deck that is looking to assemble one of many storm combos as quickly as possible, and aims to be flexible enough to pivot from combo to combo in rapid succession should the initial plan be foiled. The deck's namesake card, Underworld Breach, enables many of the combos, and is the most commonly tutored for card in the deck. Kykar is the best fit as a commander because his mana acceleration turns him into a combo piece, rather than just utility and ramp.
title: Kykar Underworld Storm

description: A fast and resilient layered combo list with Food Chain, Razaketh, and Hulk
title: Tazri Hulk

description: 5 Color Storm is an archetype that combines the best tutors, acceleration, and combo enablers in every color to assemble powerful storm turns often involving Ad Nauseam, Yawg Will, Breach, and 2-card combos such as Consultation.
title: 5 Color Storm

description: Tayam is a creature-based midrange combo deck that can combo with Devoted Druid and a pump spell to combo. Tayam decks may additional leverage common GBW strengths such as Ad Nauseam, Hatebears, and Reanimation to win. Tayam decks are usually best suited for grindy pods but suffer from board wipes and may rely on Tayam to be in play.
title: Tayam Midrange Druid

description: This is a slower storm deck that seeks to quickly land Toothy and use cantrips, wheels, and draw engines to put counters on him. From there, the goal is to resolve flicker effects on Toothy. The flickers this deck uses bring Toothy back to the battlefield immediately meaning he will see all the cards you draw from him leaving the battlefield netting you huge amounts of cards at little cost. This deck does best in a slow meta where it can use its cantrips to set up a mid game combo turn.
title: Toothy Storm

description: The deck revolves around Ral Storm Conduit and spells like Chain of Smog and Chain Stasis. It also has a Jace Oracle and Consultation package. The deck is very adaptive, winning through both lines about evenly. It can win through many stax pieces, but dies when it can't tutor. The deck falls behind when it can't find needed colors, and it often has a difficult time recovering if things get destroyed. The deck's greatest strength is it flies under the radar until it wins.
title: Sisay Tutor Chains

description: BUG Scepter storm decks tend to rely on the card quality of the BUG color combination to leverage the IsoRev combo, along with an infinite mana outlet in the command zone.
title: BUG Scepter

description: A control approach using Zur the Enchanter. Counterspells, stax pieces, and enchantments are used to control the game until Zur can fetch Necropotence and win via Rest in Peace + Helm of Obedience or Empyrial Armor + Cartouche of Ambition/Steel of the Godhead.
title: Zur Control

description: An Ad Nauseam focused combo list which leverages lifegain for better storm turns.
title: Bad Farm

decklists.title: b r a w - g o

description: A control list which uses Brago as a way to refresh mana and create draw engines.
title: Braw-Go Control

description: A storm deck which can aggressively push for wins using its commander in conjunction with typical storm lines.
title: Yidris Storm

description: A turbo-Hulk deck which uses Varolz's sacrifice and to-battlefield tutors to use Hulk.
title: Varolz Hulk

decklists.title: A Hermit, a Warrior and a Whalewolf walk into a bar...

description: This is a fast combo deck that seeks to layer Food Chain, and Consultation strategies. Like most fast combo decks, we are seeking to win as fast as possible, forgoing some of the value mid-range cards for aggressive tutors. The commander is here primarily as an outlet for Food Chain. The deck contains the very best cards in BUG, which happens to be the three best colors in cEDH.
title: Food Chain Ukkima

description: Welcome to literally a garbage rambling of someone who had some time one night and thought that somehow in a fever dream induced haze it would be a good idea to put together a pile of garbage deck with a whole bunch of explanations of how to do stupid loops with stupid cards no one in their right mind will actually play in a competitive game of EDH.
title: Urza Ironworks

description: Heavily artifact-centric and stormy, it's the closest thing to a colorless deck in cEDH.
title: Sram Cheerios

description: *MEME* This is an absolutely ridiculous attempt at making Goblin Charbelcher work in cedh. It has only 9 lands. Goal is to just rush out Charbelcher and just start doming people. Can kill the table with Dramatic Scepter. There are also a few untappers for multiple activations.
title: Golos Charbelcher

decklists.title: Twin Lightning by Hulk Chain Gang

description: A fast and graveyard-reliant combo deck which layers several win conditions together, often including Food Chain, Hulk, and sometimes Hermit Druid and Reanimator.
title: SBT Layered Combo

description: A draw-go control list which uses Rashmi to generate card advantage for counterspells.
title: Rashmi Control

description: The deck uses the fact that the goal of cEDH is to win, not to not lose. This forces each opponent into a position leaving their own game as a 3v1 while your own position is elevated into something approaching a 4v0. The goal is to assemble Flash+Hulk for Nooze combos. Due to the decks gameplan and the tools used to get there, it hypothetically has the potential to be one of the fastest decks in the format, if not the fastest.
title: Princess Hulk

description: A fast combo deck that uses its commander to assemble a win from many positions
title: Vannifar

description: A fast and cheap combo deck with high variance, fat creatures, and big mana.
title: Selvala Brostorm

description: A unique combo list which uses Final Fortune-type extra turns to combo off.
title: Kess Turns

description: A midrange deck which ramps into Momir, and combos with a color changing effect for a deterministic and consistent win. Besides combo pieces, the deck consists of a large quantity of ramp, counterspells, removal, and a few stax effects. While effective against many stax effects because of Momir’s toolboxing abilities, the deck will struggle if its ramp plan is disrupted or Momir is undefended.
title: Momir Hackball

description: A Protean Hulk/Reanimator deck which uses Mimeoplasm as a backup reanimator.
title: Mimeo Reanimator Hulk

description: A fast Grixis storm deck looking to win the game off Ad Nauseam, Peer into the Abyss or early wheels and assembling Underworld Breach lines or Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation. Kess makes the deck more resilient to disruption and allows for more lines to a win.
title: Kess Storm

description: A stormish deck which focuses on using Thrasios as both a noninfinite and infinite sink.
title: BUGR Paradox Scepter

description: *Meme* Have you ever wanted to combo off, but not win the game? This deck is for you! The main line in this deck creates an infinite stack, which, if unable to resolve will make the game end in a draw. There are Curious Control elements to the deck, but it's mainly a lands based deck. ramp ramp ramp, activate thrasios and get more lands, rinse and repeat. Sometimes we win, most of the time we don't. But just think of the value though
title: Curiously Infinite Fields

description: A food chain combo deck with a commander that both serves as an outlet and a card draw engine for grind situations
title: Food Chain Korvold

description: Shuffle Atla is a Naya stax deck that seeks to stymie its opponents mana with hatebears, and close out the game with a 2 card combo of Mirror Entity and a pump spell. The deck runs an extensive suite of creature tutors to enable its wins or to allow it to find its most relevant hatebears. It’s a primarily disruptive deck that does best in a meta where blood moon and null rod are powerful stax pieces, especially when it can lean on other disruptive decks for stack based interaction.
title: Shuffle Atla

description: Marwyn Elfball is a proactive deck that plays very similarly to Selvala Brostorm. With nearly 30 creatures, over half of which are Elves, Marwyn aims to assemble a storm-like win using pump spells and a critical mass of Elves with win conditions seen in most typical mono green cEDH decks.
title: Marwyn Elfball

description: A fast Razaketh reanimator combo deck with Ad Nauseam as a secondary plan.
title: Buried Alive Razaketh Sidisi

description: A fast and consistent combo list which is highly interactive and difficult to shut down.
title: Food Chain Sliver

description: A proactive deck that seeks to win the game as quickly as possible. Utilizes the commander as a strong value engine to assemble its resilient and dedicated combo with a discard outlet and Dakmor Salvage.
title: Gitrog Dredge

description: This is a 5 color Opus Thief deck. Look to Opus thief for a more in-depth description. This one differs though by having a dockside combo with Barrin Master Wizard. Deck also runs consultation lines with lab man, oracle, and Jace.This deck mostly uses it's many wheels to win though and the various outlets.
title: Kenrith Thief

decklists.title: Combo? Where We're Going, We Don't Need Combo

description: A discard and mana denial stax list which wins through combat damage
title: Nath Stax

description: A mono-red ramp list which assembles an infinite combo off of only its commander.
title: Godo Helm

description: Evolution is a mana combo deck with compact and overlapping cards to gain quality of cards and speed. Deck aims to win fast and quick with Thrasios activations into a lethal finale or a Timetwister loop of spells.
title: Sans Black Evolution

description: A creature-based Adaptive deck with hatebears alongside hulk and Razaketh wins
title: Junkweaver

description: An adaption of Food Chain Tazri, using Niv Mizzet at the helm
title: Food Chain Niv

description: An interactive midrange deck that uses a mix of hatebears, minor stax and instant speed disruption to interfere with opponents in the early game. It uses its commander for card advantage, ramp and its multiple hate-resistant combo finishes with Cloudstone Curio, Intruder Alarm or Aluren
title: Chulane Midrange

description: Where IS the P R I M E R
title: Hidetsugu Math

description: Mana bond storm
title: Adbond Nano

description: This deck is a midrange stax list focused on discarding, mana denial, and staying ahead of the “stax curve” while your opponents lose resources. The deck typically seeks to set up a stax’d out boardstate and end the game with a finisher such as the SquirrelCraft combo, Finale of Devastation, Torment of Hailfire, Tinybones lifedrain, or Allosaurus Shepherd elf beats. As a slower deck, there can be struggle against turbo strategies but excels if you can reel them in to Nath's pace.
title: Nath Stax

description: This deck aims to drop value engines and disrupt faster decks until enough card advantage can be accrued to force through a win attempt. Divergent Transformations and Ad Nauseam are the one-card win conditions with wheel synergies and Consultation lines as backup. This deck is most successful when there is another disruptive deck in the pod. It has game against the faster decks in the format thanks to powerful hate pieces like Rest In Peace, Cursed Totem, and Suppression Field.
title: Tymna Kraum Divergent

description: An interactive and grindy hatebear strategy that uses these creatures to gain tempo with Tymna and in board stalls with Kraum. With this gradual card advantage it can assemble various A+B combos like Jace & Tainted Pact. Thrives in metas with Hermit Druid and Storm-esque strategies.
title: T&K Bearweaver

description: A non-linear combo deck with a few stax tools. With a large variety of options and a high learning curve, this deck might test your puzzle solving skills. One of the main lines of the deck is to achieve infinite mana using Emry's versatile utility kit and shoot the table with Walking Ballista.
title: Emry

description: A control deck that utilizes the namesake card as an instant speed, compact wincon.
title: Divergent Control

description: An aggressive Flash Hulk combo deck which uses the hulk pile of Sacrifice Outlet + Blood Artist + Nomads En-Kor + Cephalid Illusionist. Along with Flash Hulk, this deck utilizes sacrifice outlets along with cards such as Pattern of Rebirth and Academy Rector to increase its consistency. Shuffle Hulk looks to leverage the ability of its hulk package to win at instant speed, along with built-in protection in the form of Memory's Journey.
title: Shuffle Hulk

description: An all-in turbo-Doomsday deck which uses Grenzo as its DD pile-cracker.
title: Doomsday Grenzo

decklists.title: Roiling Chain by Hulk Chain Gang
Cosmos Chain by Hulk Chain Gang

description: UG-based non-black Food Chain combo decks use their commanders as outlets for Food Chain combo. Because they tend to struggle to find their win condition quickly, they tend to be able to pack more interaction and hate pieces. RUG in particular will often feature Blood Moon and Back to Basics.
title: Temur Food Chain

description: Kroxa adds a unique flavor to the world of Rakdos cEDH in that he is both an outlet in the command zone and does not require activated abilities to win. Kroxa's win condition will require only one card in hand (Animate Dead) and one card in the graveyard (Worldgorger Dragon), allowing the pilot to continue the game unhindered if hands are attacked or the game state is reduced to top-decking.
title: Kroxa WGD

description: Similar to Edric Turns, but with an added Protean Hulk package with Ezuri and Sage.
title: Edric Hulk

description: A storm deck which uses wheels and cards which form soft combos with wheels
title: Opus Thief

description: Roon is a disruptive and controlling deck that looks to interact with opponents' game plans early, lock out commander centered strategies, and capitalize on the chaos in the mid to late game. Running duel combos of Roon + Eternal Witness + Time Warp and Nexus Loops funneled through Enter The Infinite, Roon is a hard hitting, resilient deck well suited for controlling players who enjoy the bant colors.
title: Roon Turns

description: BluePod is a young variant of the ever known Blood Pod deck. BluePod is based around the Combo Chains involving Birthing Pod and Kiki-Jiki ending with infinite creatures. BluePod is a tempo deck at instant speed holding counters and Thrasios activations. Soft lock stax pieces bring the game to a slower pace where multiple counters can be held up. BluePod has more redundancy in both the Kiki-Jiki and Pod lines and has a resilient plan along with the backing of infinite mana into a Thrasios win.
title: Blue Pod

description: A combo deck which uses a unique suite of combos with Animar's discount ability.
title: Harvest Animar

decklists.title: Raza Earthcraft Consult Thrasios Alarm Sans Scepter

description: A reanimator deck featuring Razaketh, which allows for fast wins with few dead cards.
title: Razakats

description: An interactive blood moon deck that aims to lock down the board with hate pieces and assemble a curiosity combo with Brallin by using the cleanup step as a discard outlet. This deck thrives in disruptive metas, as its combo bypasses most conventional stax pieces.
title: Brallin Curiosity

description: Marath Holy Trinity is a stax deck that seeks to assemble the “holy trinity” of stax pieces: Linvala, Keeper of Silence, Living Plane and Collector Ouphe to completely lock down your opponents’ ability to cast spells. In the meantime, Marath is a powerful tool for controlling the board, picking off mana dorks and small commanders with ease. Powerful support cards like Unbound Flourishing, Earthcraft and Dockside Extortionist eventually become combo pieces to put the game away.
title: Marath Stax

description: This is a reactive combo deck that seeks to pursue its combo lines while keeping a handle on what the table is doing. The main combo lines involve High Tide or Dockside Extortionist. The biggest appeal of this deck is that all of its pieces are active in the game and you don't need to hold back anything in your hand due to the nature of Vadrok.
title: Vadrok Storm

description: A low-curve, engine-oriented combo shell for Yarok that leverages cards like Cloud of Faeries, Aluren, Earthcraft and Intruder Alarm to net infinite mana off of continuous creature casts, which are fueled by bounce outlets such as Shrieking Drake, Cavern Harpy or Cloudstone Curio. Combined with an ETB draw creature like Wall of Blossoms, the deck can then win with a win card of your choice, usually with a large Finale of Devastation, Laboratory Maniac or an established Timetwister loop.
title: Yarok Aluren Alarm

description: Turbo-Ad Nauseam list which is capable of explosively fast storm wins.
title: Sidisi Ad Naus Fishbowl

description: An adaptive layered combo deck which focuses on abusing Edgar Markov's eminence ability to generate value from vampires, as well as enabling the Oathsworn Vampire combo. Markov's ability enables fast lines of play through Razaketh, Ad Nauseam and/or Skullclamp, as well as employing various interactive spells to both disrupt other gameplans and progress the decks. If several avenues to victory are removed as well as an abundance of graveyard hate are the major downfalls of the deck.
title: Markov Razaketh

description: Taigam Turns is a meta-buster control deck that uses Taigam as a strong control piece, value engine, and eventual win condition. The goal is to control the game with a fully powered suite of counter magic and stax pieces, and win through infinite turns using Mystic Sanctuary loops. The deck is highly tunable to local metas, as many of the slots in the deck are open for customization.
title: Taigam Turns

description: An adaptive, efficient, and consistent green list which can combo midgame or grind late.
title: Midrange Yisan

description: Inalla is a proactive combo deck with multiple one card win conditions backed up by the proven and powerful consultation package. What Inalla lacks in command zone value and the utility white or green provides decks, she makes up for with absolutely blistering speed backed up by an interaction suite rivaling that of many of the formats most controlling decks.
title: Inalla Wizard Combo

description: A Grixis Ad Naus/Doomsday storm list which uses Jeleva as a card advantage engine.
title: Jeleva Storm

description: This deck is a mix between zur consultation and opus thief. It established control and disruption through wheels effect like timetwister, windfall, echo of eons and whispering madness. The wincon is to cast demonic consultation or tainted pact with either labman on play or Jace
title: Aminatou Consultation

description: This is a meme deck, not really viable. 4CBB is suited for metas where you see mirror games alot. It plays Bazaar of Wonders and Spy Kit for a soft lock, and Mesmeric Orb and wheels to build yards, creating dead hands with Bazaar. cornered market is backup with kit, and possibility storm package synergizes with bazaar. Silas can recur kit, and plays with wheels for advantage. Akiri is a cheap creature to equip spy kit, and a clock. Win conditions vary, including Consult Oracle, Breach, Akiri.
title: 4C Bizarre Bazaar

commander.name: Jace, Vryn's Prodigy // Jace, Telepath Unbound

description: A storm deck which uses Jace to filter cards and recur on High Tide turns.
title: High Tide Jace

description: A doomsday paradox storm list which can take on a control role by reusing counterspells.
title: Dralnu Doomtide

description: This is a meme entry, just read the primer and we're set. With the introduction of a legendary abzan cat i was exploring the space of cat tribal in abzan and sure as all heck it's.... bad real bad. But when i was making it i realized, hey what if we take the term cEDH and take go full shitposting, the C in cEDH obviously stands for cat. And here we are, i don't expect this to get accepted but at least i tried!
title: Nethroi "cEDH"

description: This deck creates infinite mana and draws library to win. Budget friendly land base compared to 4 color Tymna builds and easier to pilot. Several tutors available to grab infinite combo pieces helps negate the loss of black, but overall must deal with being slower than BUG-based scepter decks.
title: Uro Scepter

decklists.title: b i r d w i z a r d

description: A stax deck that uses Derevi’s abilities coupled with bears to assemble mana-denial locks.
title: Derevi Stax

description: Kinnan Twister Loop is a proactive / midrange deck that aims to utilize Kinnan to generate a lot of mana and then funnel that mana into large mana pay offs. The list also runs plenty of interaction to be able to disrupt a variety of other cEDH decks while pushing towards going over the top with large amounts of mana. Eventually the deck seeks to establish infinite mana with combos like IsoRev and use Kinnan to find outlets such as Thrasios to draw most of our deck and begin twister looping. Some Kinnan lists also utilize Mirage Mirror, which allows for redundant artifact tutors to be converted into an outlet for infinite Monolith mana while maintaining high card quality.
title: Kinnan Scepter

description: Yuriko Turbo Naus is a deck that primarily focuses on winning quickly with various one card enablers such as Doomsday or Ad Nauseam. Yuriko herself helps the deck grind when needed and her cheap creatures help enable various turbo naus cards such as Culling the Weak.
title: Yuriko Turbo Naus

description: KCI Teshar is a unique fast combo deck based on artifacts and highly synergistic and complex to pilot, based on the graveyard recursion ability of Teshar, Ancestor's Apostle. It has several overlapping redundant combo pieces, giving the necessary consistency to reach the numerous possibilities involving looping artifacts to win the game quickly and with some security against common disrupts such as counters and artifact removals, due to recursion provided by the commander.
title: KCI Teshar

description: A Paradox Engine combo deck which can switch between fast combo and stax gameplans.
title: Paradox Sisay

description: A more interactive Zur list which runs Labman/Consultation with supplementing storm.
title: Zuran Consultation

description: Not Protean Reanimator Hulk is a hyper aggressive 2 card combo that can end the game within the first 4 turns and can sometimes win on turn 3 with the right cards. The deck focus around finding Buried Alive and any reanimation spell to create a loop that reanimates Gray Merchant of Asphodel and kills your opponents by abusing not Protean Hulk, but Rot Hulk and its ability to reanimate multiple Zombies
title: Not Protean Reanimator Hulk

description: A meme deck based around stealing Food Chain from a player, and using it to infinite out Food Chain style (cast/exile Urza infinitely to get infinite constructs for infinite real mana). At it's core, this deck is still an Urza Scepter deck, so if disruption ruins your meme plan, you can pivot back to the other Win Cons. Also, based on your meta, simply flashing in Aura Thief or Agent of Treachery to steal enchantments or a win con is a solid game plan as well.
title: Urza Flash Scepter

description: An aggressive Thrasios/Tymna list looking to leverage the former Shuffle Hulk package of sacrifice outlets + Academy Rector and Pattern of Rebirth, as well as reanimation in the form of Necromancy to enable protean hulk
title: Thrasios Tymna Protean Hulk

description: Naru Meha is an instant-speed strategy aiming to play counter-control. This is a land-go deck that controls the game early and sculpts your hand with interaction early-mid game. Matchups are bad against heavy tax or other stax effects and decks/metas full of control decks. The commander is an instant-speed one-card combo in the command zone. Key cards include, Ghostly Flicker, Whispers of the Muse, Ashnod's Altar, Blue Sun's Zenith, and Illusionist's Stratagem.
title: Naru Meha Flicker

description: A blue control deck that runs a high density of counterspells and instant-speed draw.
title: Baral Control

description: An extremely fast combo list which layers Flash Hulk with Razaketh + Breakfast + Druid.
title: 4c Lightning Druid

description: A slower Flash Hulk combo list which runs multiple backup plans and hatebears.
title: Hulkweaver

description: Niv-Mizz Parun Control, is a control shell similar to Rashmi, Curious Control, and Tasigur that seeks to slow the game down with Stax, prevent wins with interaction, and eventually end the game with a resolved Niv Mizzet. Compact combos include Curiosity effect on Niv-Mizzet, or sometimes with Glint-Horn Buccaneer or Isochron Scepter + Dramatic Reversal. Does poorly against multiple fast, low-interaction, decks. Does well against mid-range or other control lists.
title: Niv-Mizzet Parun Control

description: Yuriko is used primarily as a card advantage engine in the command zone which circumvents commander tax. Yuriko is able to run Oracle/Consult and Doomsday lines as primary win conditions
title: Yuriko Doomsday Oracle

description: Divergent Kykar looks to utilize Divergent Transformations and the similar Synthetic Destiny to use Kykar's token generation as a compact and mana efficient win condition, turning them into the Niv-Mizzet, Parun + Tandem Lookout combo to win the game. Along with this main win condition, Divergent Kykar uses the Sensei's Divining Top + Future Sight combo, as well as Isochron Scepter + Dramatic Reversal to present a consistent and resilient win condition package.
title: Divergent Kykar

description: An 5c breakfast hulk layering Najeela combos for lines that win through grave hate.
title: Najeela Hermit Hulk

description: Have you ever wanted to win with Gates as early as turn two. Well here is your chance. Breach The Gates is an Aggro turbo druid combo deck that seeks to deploy a Hermit Druid and activate it to win with Mazes End for G mana. It has Nauseam and Consultation backup lines that can also win the game using Mazes End or Oracle.
title: Breach the Gates

description: Jhoira Storm aims to disrupt opponent's battlefields with stax effects and a small sutie of counterspells, then assemble a game-winning combo during a single turn. A wide range of tutorable win-cons and Jhoira's innate card draw ability make digging easy in this deck.
title: Jhoira Stax Storm

description: A midrange deck which runs a high density of sac outlets and ways to cheat Hulk into play.
title: T&T Hulkball

description: A midrange Thassa's Oracle list which is exceptionally difficult to stax out.
title: Kess Midrange

description: A low-curve, engine-oriented combo shell for Yarok that leverages cards like Cloud of Faeries, Aluren, Earthcraft and Intruder Alarm to net infinite mana off of continuous creature casts, which are fueled by bounce outlets such as Shrieking Drake, Cavern Harpy or Cloudstone Curio. Combined with an ETB draw creature like Wall of Blossoms, the deck can then win with a win card of your choice, usually with a large Finale of Devastation, Laboratory Maniac or an established Timetwister loop.
title: Yarok Aluren Alarm

description: This deck is similar to old Breakfast Flash Hulk decks utilizing the same breakfast pile except instead of Flash, we use Through the Breach as a 5 mana Flash that sacrifices Hulk end of turn. This deck is using Golos as its commander because it can tutor for Boseiju to make our combo uncounterable or Cephalid Coliseum to beat other Thassa's Oracle decks. In addition, we run Dockside Sabertooth as another Hulk pile that gives us infinite mana and with Golos, cast our entire deck.
title: Golos Not Flash Hulk

description: Fast jund storm deck focused on Underworld Breach, Ad Nauseam and Dockside (please check the primer section for more info)
title: Korvold Turbo Ad Naus

decklists.title: Snoop Tharry Tharr [Primer]: Gruul Was the Hand They Dealt Me

description: Snoop Tharr is an Adaptive, Creature-Based, Midrange deck that preys on non-creature heavy decks. It leverages early mana dorks, disruptive hatebears, and quick combo lines to win. Snoop Tharr is unique among cEDH decks for adopting the 1-card combo of Goblin Recruiter into a Conspicuous Snoop pile. Our game plan is to soften up life totals with Thar, help answer early combos as needed, and then develop a board state or hand that allows us to advance comfortably towards a win.
title: Snoop Tharr

description: This deck aims to control the game using countermagic and stax effects long enough to execute one of multiple game-winning combos. The primary combo in this deck uses the commander, Tawnos, with Sands of Time to generate infinite mana during the upkeep. Since Tawnos himself is very cheap, and assembling a two-card combo with a deck's commander is very easy, especially if there are many available tutors, this deck can win relatively fast for a control deck, giving it a slight edge on slower decks in the format while still being able to keep up with the faster decks.
title: Tawnos Control

description: Meme deck based on the hit TV show Friends.
title: FRIENDS

description: Layered Kiki is a layered combo deck that centers around Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker. A proactive, midrange, creature-based deck, the deck incorporates the classic Meta Pod combo lines with Conspicuous Snoop and Protean Hulk lines to attempt a win at any and every phase of the game. With a surprising amount of layering, the deck allows for constant pivoting and makes up for its lower card quality with strong synergy. It also takes advantage of the current meta where hard counters are being replaced by cheaper but more restrictive counters that often can't interact with the creature combos this deck uses.
title: Tymna Tana Protean Hulk

description: "Whatever Yawgmoth marks, dies. There is no escape." - Tsabo Tavoc. Draw engine, mass removal, and part of a three card combo in its own right, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician is a flexible commander with devastating potential at all points of the game. Turbo out a quick storm kill or grind your opponents to dust, the Grand Evolution is inevitable. Yawgmoth craves only one commodity, glory to Phyreixa.
title: Yawgmoth Undying Combo

description: Belzenaus is an extremely proactive deck focused on ramping into Demonlord Belzenlok, and playing him to draw our entire deck in one go. This requires not playing anything with a cmc of 3 or less, but this deck rises to the challenge, and can win as early as turn 3. Deck perks include an average cmc of 4.69, suprise Gonti into somebody else's Thassa's Oracle, and our guest star, Uncle Istvan.
title: Belzenaus

description: A Temur control deck that aims to slow the game down with counterspells and interaction, maintain card advantage with various creatures/enchantments, and eventually win the game with Dockside Extortionist and Kinnan, Bonder Prodigy combos.
title: Temur Control

description: A sans-white turbo Ad Nauseam strategy that focuses on powerful early starts to end the game quickly, focusing on the common grixis core of fast Ad Nauseam strategies in conjunction with Underworld Breach and Dockside Extortionist. When it is unable to win quickly, it can utilize the powerful card advantage engine Kraum provides while keeping Ad Nauseam relevant and lethal even in the later stages of the game through Ikra Shidiqi's lifegain.
title: Ikra Kraum Turbo Naus

description: This deck looks to win the game early as turn 2  by using Hermit Druid as a one-card combo.
title: Kenrith Druid

description: Kenrith Midrange is an adaptive deck that really wants to out value other decks through multiple lines that generate card value. Typical wincons include Oracle Consult and Dockside Mayhem loops with Kenrith.
title: Kenrith Midrange

description: Winota Snowball Stax seeks to be an explosive stax combo deck that wants to play nonhuman creatures early and then play its commander. Winota cheats creatures into play at an alarming rate and the deck can overwhelm the board quite easily. The explosive nature of the deck in combination with its tightly layered combos allow for the first real opportunity for Boros to play at the competitive tables.
title: Winota Stax

description: A proactive Doomsday deck that utilizes its commander to crack the piles, to win with Kiki-Jiki and Zealous Conscripts, with a variety of backup win conditions, such Redcap combo or Snoop lines. The decks primary goal is to make a lot of fast mana and utilize it to make explosive plays.
title: Grenzo Doomsday

description: A sans-black midrange deck that capitalizes on Thrasios activations. Primarily wins using Monolith and Dockside combos
title: Dawnwaker Thrasios

description: Typically a midrange list that utilizes either IsoRev or Oracle Consult as wincons
title: Dimir Scepter

decklists.title: 🌊 Urza Poly Tyrant 🌊"The Tide pod Challenge"🌀

description: Urza, Lord High Artificer leverages fast artifact mana and wincons such as Isochron Scepter + Dramatic Reversal, and Power Artifact + Grim Monolith. Additionally, Urza has the unique benefit of breaking parity with mana denial stax pieces such as Static Orb and Winter Orb. It also utilizes cards such as Trail of Evidence as powerful mana and card advantage engines. The Poly versions look to win with Polymorph / Proteus Staff getting Tidespout Tyrant to generate infinite mana.
title: Urza Polymorph Tyrant
